reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THe hotel was dificult to find at first, but once you get there, everything from that point on was great. The room, location of the hotel in the old part of Strasbourg was perfect. We walked to restaurants, shopping and had a room over the water. perfect!
reviews.title: French hotel

reviews.text: Suite was good for our family of four. Interesting building situated in the heart of old city. Enjoyed strolling around town. Bell service excellent! Agree with comments about need for updating, decorations and a/c. Not what I expected for the money but still the location and setting made up for all the deficits.
reviews.title: Location Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since Strasbourg is such an old cobblestoned city, I expected the hotel to be full of antiques. Oh no, It was ultra modern and very artsy. We loved the location and we enjoyed the modern room. The staff was helpful but not overly friendly. We loved the canals and the city. Yes it is worth a visit and a stay.
reviews.title: Old location but ultra modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I researched the Hotel Regent Petite France for a previous trip to Strasbourg, but we stayed elsewhere. On this trip, we decided to book the hotel and were very excited about staying there based on reviews, and the location. First, I will say that the location is excellent, right on the canal in Petite France. Other than that, though, the hotel was a tremendous disappointment. We booked the hotel for 3 nights. When we arrived, the person at check-in was pleasant but not very friendly. I had expected the service to be very good, so it seemed odd. When we arrived at our room, I was surprised to see how starkly furnished the room was. There was nothing comforting about the look of the room. Very little furniture, almost no artwork. It reminded me of an addition to a house that has not yet been decorated, but has some furniture. The windows werre open when we arrived, but it was still very warm in the room (80's F). We were very tired, but decied to go out to get something to eat before unpacking, so we closed the windows and turned the A/C on. When we returned to our room 90 minutes later, it was just as hot, and very stuffy. The AC clearly was not working. When we spoke to the Front desk about this, they casually remarked that they were having some work done to the HVAC system and that the A/C would be out for the rest of the week. There was no apology, as if this was completely normal. We asked if there were other rooms in the hotel which might be cooler (ours was on the top floor) and were informed that the hotel was completely booked. At this point we were incensed and started to demand something be done. In the end, the staff made arrangements for us at their sister hotel - Cour Corbeau. This was done grudgingly. There was one person who was, in fact, very helpful, polite, and apologetic, I believe his name was Guillaume, and he was a Bellman. He had an awareness of the sitution, and tried to do everything he could to help. I can't for the life of me understand how this hotel gets such high ratings. The rooms were not at all well decorated, or nicely furnished, and the service was poor. The location must be the one thing that satisfies guests.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing Hotel and Service

reviews.text: For the hotel to know that AC was going to be out, in June, and to do nothing to notify guests in advance is unacceptable. And for the service to be so lacking in regard to dealing with guests put out by this is unbelievable. For the record, our stay at Cour Corbeau was excellent. they are deserving of the excellent reviews here. I will write one shortly.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel situated right in the middle of Petite France and the tourist areas. It is easily within walking distance to everything. The rooms are really clean and well furnished with modern decor. Staff at the hotel were all very friendly and very helpful - they were always greeting you, smiling and all speak English which is obviously very helpful. You can easily see why it is a 4 star hotel. The atmosphere within the hotel was very calm and peaceful. The hotel actually sits over part of the river and there is a lovely terrace to sit out on. We had a Junior Suite that was very spacious and it also looked out over the river. There are many restaurants within easy walking distance. Parking was easy and we had a choice of a secured garage or outside parking. We would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel Beautiful Location

reviews.text: This is the third time we stay at the Regent. It is an excellent hotel which carries its 4 stars with ease, it is in some aspects also a 5-star hotel. It is separated into three different building which all connects to the lobby.
reviews.title: Excellent - Highly recommended

reviews.text: The location is absolutely superb to examine Strasbourg and Alsace. You will live spot-on in the middle of the main tourist attraction, Petit France and you are within walking distance on the trams, the Cathedral, Place Kleber for the Christmas market as well as everything else. You reach 10+ restaurants within 100 meters of walking, some just 30-40 meters away.
reviews.title: modern & stylish hotel in the midst of Petite France

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The deluxe room we got was spacious, well equipped, elegant and had a great view towards the river. It had a well-space bathroom with closet, in tub-shower, double sinks, hairdryer and clothes dryer.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous - Totally Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hallways, the elevators and the rest of the hotel is also great. Very clean everywhere and with nice aspects such as transparent walls to the old mill, which shows large wheels and pumps. The river flows under the hotel in some parts, which is really charming. At night, you can hear the river if you open the windows. It is a great way to fall asleep.
reviews.title: Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed three nights and we were upgraded to a suite (210). Very comfortable, quiet, great location, lovely view. Breakfast at 22 euros is a bit steep though, especially when there's no fresh fruit. But the hotel itself is excellent and staff were great too. Wouldn't hesitate to go back.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We very much enjoyed our three night stay here in Petit France, Strasbourg. We were in the loft room which was very comfortable and very quiet, although we did like to leave the windows open at night to hear the water gushing around either side of the hotel (being a former water mill - somehow used to make ice!). The front desk staff were very friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was very pleasant (despite no toaster) and dinner on the deck overlooking the canal felt surreal, as the outlook is beautiful across to the half timbered houses. Great position as well, easy walk to all the sights.
reviews.title: Lovely in every way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Regent is located in the cobblestone streets of Strasbourg's Old City. I believe the building was once a mill and a river/mill slices through past and through it, with other historic building's lining the water, their reflections shimmering in the water. It can feel magical, the planners of Disneyland must've wandered through it.
reviews.title: A hotel in the heart of Disneyland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel, itself, has an attractive lobby. The room was sleek and more than ample and looked out on a plaza--very nice. Service at the desk was terrific: friendly and knowledgeable. Restaurants were abundant nearby, serving a full range of cuisine, including traditional Alsatian food (lots of sausage; lots of cheese!)
reviews.title: We enjoyed our one night at this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cathedral in Strasbourg is magnificent; it's stained glass windows are ethereal. And on the city's periphery is the European Parliament and other EU related buildings, their modernism a far cry from Strasbourg's quaint old town and its soaring Gothic cathedral.
reviews.title: Gorgeous property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is excellent! The location is perfect as are the views from the hotel. The room was spacious, well equipped and very pleasant. Best of all the staff were friendly, helpful and accommodating - nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I couldn't recommend it more strongly!
reviews.title: Really Quite Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So upon approach I was thinking we were going to experience a quaint antique style hotel based on the exterior. It wasn't but we weren't disappointed a bit. It has a wonderful modern touch that works very well in the old town.
reviews.title: Expensive but worth it for the location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Though the front desk was a bit stoic the rest of the staff were much more approachable. Not that the desk crew was rude, just a bit matter of fact for my liking. The patio is great for drinks and watching the day, though we didn't eat there, I heard the restaurant was very good, too.
reviews.title: best location in town!
Disappointing: not worth the money!
reviews.text: Would 100% stay here again.
